newsitem.title: USA: U.S. weekly rice cash market summary -- USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. weekly rice cash market summary -- USDA.

text.p: In the South, rice prices were steady. Long grain milled rice prices were weak, selling mostly at $20.50 to $21.00 per cwt; medium grain traded mostly at $19.00; second heads were steady and brewers remain in very tight supply with few quotes at $14.00 to $15.00.
Rice by-products were lower and bran was mostly steady to $5.00 lower and millfeed was steady to $9.00 lower, USDA said in its weekly cash rice report.
In California, rice prices were steady with medium grain selling mostly from $18.00 to $19.00, bran was nominally $7.00 higher at $115.00.
California rice ship loadings: For the week ending April 5, 1997, at the Port of Sacramento: the Sanko Prelude loaded 20,790 mt of U.S. No. 1 medium grain milled bulk rice destined for Turkey.

Inspections of California rice for export: For the week ending April 5, 1997, there were 458,562 cwt of medium grain milled rice inspected. The yearly total since October 1, 1996 is 8,230,207 cwt compared to 5,848,093 cwt a year ago.
Feed by-products prices (dollars per short ton, FOB mills).
